name: excursionist

a person who goes on an excursion (= a short journey usually made for pleasure, often by a group of people): There were charming walks around the castle, where excursionists could enjoy the natural beauty that surrounded them. The boat carried the excursionists upstream to the town. Related word
excursion
More examplesFewer examplesThere was a crush of excursionists on the station platform.At the restaurant, the excursionists each had a large piece of cake and a cup of tea. She checks all the hotels and restaurants herself to ensure that her excursionists have the best possible experience.
